intro: Hieracium velutiniforme, commonly known as the velvetleaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring a hairy stem and basal leaves that are broadly ovate to lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early summer. Hieracium velutiniforme is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
